intro: Stachytarpheta canescens var. morii, commonly known as the silverleaf bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and prolonged blooming period. It is often used in landscaping for its aesthetic appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
